text:
"I sat in my room like a spider," he said. 

"Why don’t you work?" Sonia asked. 

"I won’t go out. I hate this place." 

He lay in the dark, thinking. 

"I didn’t even ask for food," he admitted. 

Nastasya brought him scraps. He ate when he had to. 

"Why am I so stupid?" he pondered. 

"Men won’t change," he declared. 

"Only the strong will have power." 

Sonia listened, her heart heavy. 

"Whoever dares the most is right." 

He looked at her, eyes wild with dreams. 

"I’ve been sulking too long."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on his isolation and the futility of waiting for others to change, concluding that true power lies in strength of mind and daring.
